Object Property Randomization Module

The ObjectPropertyRandomization class provides static methods to generate random colors, sizes, and z-axis rotations for objects within the PITA Algorithm framework. These methods enable the creation of diverse and visually distinct simulation environments by randomizing object properties based on user-defined ranges or criteria.

Key Functionalities

  • Random Color Generation: Produces RGBA color values for objects, supporting group-based color randomization to maintain visual coherence among objects belonging to the same group.

  • Random Size Generation: Computes 3D size values within specified ranges, facilitating size variation among simulation objects and enabling the creation of size-based groupings.

  • Random Z-axis Rotation: Determines random z-axis rotations for objects, allowing for varied object orientations within the simulation environment.

class pitapy.utils.object_property_randomization.ObjectPropertyRandomization[source]

Bases: object

Generates random colors, sizes and z-rotation depending on user input.

static get_random_colors(amount: int, color_groups: tuple[int, int] | None) → list[list[float]] | None[source]

Returns a list of random rgba colors (with alpha=1).

Parameters:

  • amount (int) – Number of objects

  • color_groups (Union[tuple[int, int], None]) – Range of members per distinctly colored group

Returns:

List of randomized rgba colors

(with duplicate entries for each group member, if color_groups > 1)

Return type:

colors_for_placement (Union[list[list[float]], None])

static get_random_rotation(amount: int, z_rotation_range: tuple[int, int] | None) → list[float] | None[source]

Generate random number in z_rotation_range.

Parameters:

  • amount (int) – Number of objects

  • z_rotation_range (Union[tuple[int, int], None]) – Range of degrees for randomization of z-axis

Returns:

Random numbers in given range for z-axis rotation

Return type:

z_rotations_for_placement (Union[list[float], None])

static get_random_sizes(amount: int, size_groups: tuple[float, float] | None, size_value_range: tuple[float, float] | None) → list[list[float]] | None[source]

Returns a list of random sizes.

Parameters:

  • amount (int) – Number of objects

  • size_groups (Union[tuple[float, float], None]) – Range of members per distinctly sized group

  • size_value_range (Union[tuple[float, float], None]) – Defines the value size of the randomization process

Returns:

List of randomized sizes

(with duplicate entries for each group member, if size_groups > 1)

Return type:

sizes_for_placement (Union[list(float, float, float), None])
